basic.floral_language:
Echeveria albicans 
Floriography: lovely, delicate, warm
Echeveria albicans is a small Echeveria with elegant leaves, thick pale green leaves, spectacular, recess in the middle, spiny tip, tightly arranged like an open lotus flower. Leaf edges may be pinkish under full sunlight.
Echeveria albicans likes sunlight, when being dormant under summer high temperatures, avoid direct sunlight for better care. Sometimes blooms with paly yellow flowers
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, flowering period in spring with light yellow flowers
basic.color: Leaf color light green, when sunny leaf edges turning to pink

maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.sunlight: Like sunshine, like adequate sunlight, dormant in summer under high temperatures, put in places with scattered light
maintenance.watering: Do not water frequently, keep a dry environment, stop watering when in summer dormancy
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply once monthly, except summer
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
